title: Mario Paraschiv.
subtext: Software Engineer devoted to creating fluid and easy to use software.

information: I am driven by competitiveness, aiming to develop polished, performant, and beautifully designed applications. I strive for perfection and invest heavily in optimization, whether it's in my code or personal life. Finding flaws in myself and my work drives me to perfect my craft.

Recognizing the importance of self-care, I prioritize activities like working out and getting enough sleep, considering them crucial steps for promoting mental growth and accelerating my career as a Software Engineer.
journey: My coding journey commenced 5 years ago with Discord's API user experience enhancement using bots. It involved integrating a back-end service, API and website for streamlined user configuration, powered by OAuth2.

Progressing further, I immersed myself in web development, mastering ReactJS and many popular technologies such as Tailwind CSS, Next.js and animation libraries to achieve the peak visual experience. To this day, I relish the opportunity to delve into new concepts and technologies, constantly pushing the boundaries of my understanding and skills.
work: Feel free to reach out if you are interested in working with me. I am dedicated to exploring collaborative opportunities that align with my expertise and passions.
Whether you have a project in mind, wish to discuss potential collaborations, or simply want to connect, I am always open to new opportunities and eager to engage in meaningful discussions.

projects.name: Unbound
overview: Unbound is an open-source transformative modification designed to empower users of the Discord mobile app with unprecedented levels of customization. Offering a rich array of features, from plug-ins to themes, fonts, and icon packs, Unbound redefines the user experience, providing a platform for personalization unlike any other.

projects.name: Kiwa
overview: Kiwa is an Aix-en-Provence-based Asian fusion restaurant.
This project takes a modern approach to web design by using a monochrome style and emphasising the cuisine rather than the website.
The website is available in both French and English, with a language changer that automatically selects the language of the website based on the user's operating system/browser preferences.
The app features 4 sections: Home, a menu section, a reservations section and a FAQ section.

This project is built for both mobile and desktop. By using Tailwind CSS, I am able to control breakpoint-based styling effortlessly allowing me to easily ensure that the mobile experience is consistent.
responsibilities: It makes use of a proprietary internationalisation implementation that is similar to the abilities of certain famous React.js frameworks.
This project takes advantage of Chrome's View Transitions API, which allows for seamless transitions throughout the website, such as when switching between dark and bright modes.
Under the hood, the website uses Radix UI as the base for its components, providing accessibility to its users.
